thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Manchester City teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by Gunners… and tussle is turning nasty
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Manchester City teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by Gunners… and tussle is turning nasty

author: tgannon
title: Arsenal transfer news: Manchester City teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by Gunners… and tussle is turning nasty
text:
Comments MANCHESTER CITY teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by Arsenal and the transfer tussle is turning nasty. 
The quick winger, 17 next month, was signed from Watford for £500,000 in 2015 and has starred for City’s academy and in the England youth ranks. Getty Images 4 Manchester City teen Jadon Sancho is wanted by rivals Arsenal 
The Gunners’ top scout Steve Rowley has been tracking him and City are worried the potential first-teamer could be lured away. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Sancho has trained with Pep Guardiola’s top squad but a return to the capital with Arsenal may be too much to resist. AP:Associated Press 4 Arsene Wenger’s top scout Steve Rowley has been tracking Jadon Sancho 
GENT keeper Lovre Kalinic is ready to grab his Premier League chance at the second time of asking. 
The giant Croatian international starred against Tottenham as his Belgian club dumped them out of the Europa League last week. 
Kalinic, 26, was watched by scouts from Everton, Southampton and West Ham at Wembley — and it is the Toffees who are poised for a swoop in the summer as manager Ronald Koeman looks for a new No 1. 
The 6ft 7in keeper, who has only been with Gent since last month, was denied a move to Aston Villa last season when he was playing for Hajduk Split in Croatia. 
He failed to get a work permit in a controversial case. Getty Images 4 Gent keeper Lovre Kalinic is ready to grab his Premier League chance at the second time of asking 
Southampton and England star Fraser Forster is Everton’s current top choice and the fact the Saints are actively checking out Kalinic is a sign Forster may be on his way at the end of the season. 
Hammers manager Slaven Bilic is also an admirer and is ready to make a move when the bidding starts, with Gent looking for about £10million for the keeper. 
A work permit should be a certainty if any club offers the right package, pushing up his points total under the new system. Related Stories OZIL'S KEBABS Arsenal star Mesut Ozil gets to work in a London kebab shop as Arsenal have a weekend off Pep for England Paul Scholes backs Manchester City coach Pep Guardiola to take charge of the England team CHIPS ARE DOWN Arsenal chief Sir Chips Keswick hints club won't bow to huge wage demands of Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez Keep the faith Five potential Man City summer signings to resolve Pep Guardiola's goalkeeping crisis RECORD FIGURES Arsenal have revealed increased football turnover to just under £200m, with £110.5m invested in players Manchester City star Ilkay Gundogan shooting hoops with some water bottles! 
NOTTINGHAM FOREST are heading for their THIRD takeover bid in a year as Fawaz Al Hasawi frets about his long-term plans. 
A new foreign group, headed by an English deal-maker, have sounded out the Kuwaiti. 
Both Greek Evangelos Marinakis and American John Jay Moores failed in bids for the club. 
BLACKBURN owners Venky’s want to cut the payroll again next term. 
Rovers slashed the wage bill to £16m with disastrous effects in this campaign. Venky’s believe they can squeeze it down further to £10m. 
But out-of-contract stars Ryan Lowe, Hope Akpan, Danny Guthrie and Adam Henley would have to leave. 
BURNLEY will push through a summer move for Barnsley’s skipper Marc Roberts after holding back in the last window. 
Top spy Martin Hodge has been a regular sight at Tykes’ games to watch the centre-half, 26. Reuters 4 Burnley will push through a summer move for Barnsley’s skipper Marc Roberts after holding back in the last window 
But Clarets’ insiders think the reason they held off trying to buy him in January was to avoid unsettling James Tarkowski. 
Boss Sean Dyche does not want to sell Michael Keane and is happy to have him and Ben Mee, while Roberts’ arrival would have pushed Tarkowski further down the pecking order. 
WOLVES are ready to sell Helder Costa — with Liverpool keen on the flying winger who helped put them out of the FA Cup. 
Costa, 23, only signed a permanent deal with the Midlanders in January, completing a £13m switch from Benfica after an impressive loan spell at Molineux. 
But with Wolves way off the pace in the Championship, they may cash in on their star. 
The Portugal Under-23 ace’s agents are keen on a move to the top flight — and will push hard if a Prem club makes a bid. Arsenal star Mesut Ozil in training at the gym ahead of their next game
